text.div:
PACIOFunctionalPerformanceImplementationGuide

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/pacio-fp/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.pacio-fp

FHIR Implementation Guide to exchange functional performance data and assessments between post-acute care (PAC) and other providers, patients, and key stakeholders

name: PACIOFunctionalPerformanceImplementationGuide
title: PACIO Functional Performance Implementation Guide
description: FHIR Implementation Guide to exchange functional performance data and assessments between post-acute care (PAC) and other providers, patients, and key stakeholders

resource.name: Functional Performance Collection
resource.description: A point in time collection of post-acute care observations for a patient. This profile is used for exchanging a set of observation data collected through the use of a structured resource (e.g. assessment tool, instrument, or screen).

resource.name: Functional Performance Narrative History of Status
resource.description: An exchange of summary observation regarding the most recent prior status immediately preceding the current admission, illness, or exacerbation for a patient. The use of this profile is encouraged in the absence of formal prior level assessments. For formal assessments conducted with for example, an assessment instrument, use the PAC Collection and PAC Observation profiles to capture assessment data.

resource.name: Functional Performance Observation
resource.description: An exchange of post-acute care observation for a patient. This profile is used for exchanging a single observation data generally included in a set of observation data collected through the use of a structured resource (e.g. assessment tool, instrument, or screen).

resource.name: Functional Performance Use of Device
resource.description: A record of an assistive device--e.g. eyeglasses or hearing aid, being used by a patient during a post-acute care observation. This profile based on the DeviceUseStatement resource provides a way to include information about device usage during an assessment.

resource.name: AssistanceRequired
resource.description: Associated with the Narrative History of Status profile to provide a high-level indication of assistance required for the personâ€™s baseline ability (status immediately preceding the current admission, illness, or exacerbation for a patient). The CMS Assessment answer list LL4309-2 provides possible values for this extension.

resource.name: DevicePatientUsed
resource.description: Associated with the PAC Collection profile to point to a record indicating what healthcare-related assistive device was used by a patient during an observation. This extension leverages the DeviceUseStatement resource instead of Device resource so as to indicate appropriately a record of assistive device usage by a patient.

resource.name: ObservationEventLocation
resource.description: This extension is used to indicate the principal physical location where an observation event occurred.

resource.name: Functional Performance Category Value Set
resource.description: Codes for the classification of functional indicators.

resource.name: Functional Performance Functioning Category Value Set
resource.description: Codes for the classification of patient observation. This is an extension of the ObservationCategoryCodes value set

resource.name: Functional Performance ValueSet LOINC SNOMED
resource.description: This value set contains all of LOINC and SNOMED CT.

resource.name: Functional Performance Category
resource.description: Codes for functional performance categories

resource.name: Functional Performance Functioning Category Code System
resource.description: Defining a specific code for the classification of patient observation regarding individual's functioning.

resource.name: PACIO Functional Performance Capability Statement
resource.description: This Capability Statement defines the expected capabilities of a PACIO Functional Performance FHIR server conforming to the PACIO Functional Performance Implementation Guide.
